H0.text: Chemical energy is produced when a guitar string vibrates.

H1.text: Light is the form of energy produced when a guitar string vibrates.

H2.text: Magnetic energy is produced when a guitar string vibrates.

H3.text: Sound is the form of energy produced when a guitar string vibrates.

A4.text: Sound is propagated by progressive longitudinal vibratory disturbances (sound waves).

A5.text: Sound waves are generated by a sound source, such as the vibrating diaphragm of a stereo speaker.
